title: Al Jolson
summary: Al Jolson (born Asa Yoelson; May 26, 1886 â€“ October 23, 1950) was an American singer, comedian, actor, and vaudevillian. Self-billed as "The World's Greatest Entertainer",[1] Jolson is credited with being America's most famous and highest-paid star of the 1920s.[2] He was known for his "shamelessly sentimental, melodramatic approach",[3] and for popularizing many of the songs he performed.[4] Jolson has been referred to by modern critics as "the king of blackface performers".[5][6]
